column2: text
Careening across the battlefield, smashing everything on contact and incinerating anything too close with bolts of savage Warpstone lightning.
These sentinels mark the borders of the Tomb Kings' realm, submerged in the sand, waiting to strike at the unsuspecting.
In battle, the Dwarfen Lord gets lost in the melee with hammer in hand, strong as a dozen Dwarfen soldiers.
The harshest of wildernesses creates the most brutal of hunters.
With spinning scythes and a spike-laden chassis, this chariot causes maximum bloodshed with its devastating charge.
Keep your mouth shut and your head down if you want to live.
The Undead devotees of the Tomb Kings are risen again, unswervingly loyal to their liege.
Spears extend, like gnarled and sharpened bones, held firmly in place by their deathly-grip.
These spellcasters use the Lore of Life to protect friendly troops, yet frustrate and confound enemies.
The living are scythed down as these nightmarish beasts glide and bound amongst their helpless, terrified prey.
Those able to ride Cold Ones charge headlong into enemy lines, thrashing with crude but effective clubs.
Those able to ride Cold Ones charge headlong into enemy lines, thrashing with crude but effective clubs.
The nimblest Ungors of the herds, originating from one of the most ancient woods in the Old World.
These eminent horsemen were previously entrusted to defend Bretonnian lands to their dying breath – an event that has long past.
The perfect shock troop smashes into enemy lines, devastating their confidence by inflicting many casualties.
Majesty and power personified, their devastating charge exemplifying their regal brilliance.
The Eternal Challenger is bound to a lifetime of constant duelling and violent killing.
What cannot be solved with poisons and subterfuge from afar, is dealt with up close with twin blades of death.
A piercing arrow is debilitating enough, yet all manner of filth and corrosion is loosed from their crude bows.
Entombed alongside their mighty sovereign, Nehekhara's deathless princes are reawakened to command the Undead legions.
The diving Terrorgheist, with a terrifying scream, seeds death and havoc amongst its enemies.
If you're facing Ikit's cannon crew, chances are you're already dead!
Before the Elves there were the Ancients. If woken from their slumber, it is always to defend the forest.
A powerful flurry of knots and branches, striking out in the midst of the battle; the will of the forest made real.
The biggest, nastiest, most bad-tempered of Big 'Uns, this elite mob will stomp ya and jump about on da bitz afterwards.
The Hellbeast’s belly bulges with thousands of screeching rats, frantically scratching at bloody walls to escape their fleshy prison.
Marching to war with magical machinations; outrageous and heretical, but most of all deadly.
Gorebulls do not hesitate, smashing into enemy ranks with overwhelming power.
Zombie pirate crews love dragging a big gun into a fight, no matter how unwieldy it might be!
Fleet Terradons marked for greatness by the Old Ones.
Stealthy and steadfast, these redoubtable Rangers carry both throwing and great axes – the latter for dealing with the more ‘imposing’ opponents.
The most junior of Knights, they fight determinedly to make a name for themselves.
The personification of purity and devotion, striving to become the most honourable Knights of the Realm.
All who stand before the Mad Titan are likely trampled underfoot, if not first debilitated by his putrid flatulence!
As swift as the wind, dark as the shadows, deadly as a thousand blades.
Chaos Marauders are the rank and file of Chaos armies, perfectly placed in the centre of battle, bloodied weapon in hand.
Armed to da teef and always ready for a scrap, this elite Black Orc regiment wear distinctive red armour.
Once an awe-inspiring parade of powerful beasts, now reduced to the last few dangerous descendants of the legendary herd.
Armed with poison, so even a glancing blow may mean agonising death to the target.
Lightly armoured and nimble beyond the ken of most, Clan Eshin's death squads move fast and kill quickly.
Centuries of defending the forest against the malevolent spirits of the Wildwood has gifted them an unparalleled vigilance.
As stern and determined as the endless ocean, and as savage as the rolling tempest.
Victims find out too late that the enchanting creature gliding towards them is not a woman, but a savage, rabid beast!
Stalwart defenders of the crypts, Grave Guards possess a fighting skill beyond that of the usual wights.
Pure airborne majesty, it brings fire and death as it swoops down over enemy lines.
Light Wizards illuminate their foes with magic drawn from the Lore of Light, blazing and binding enemies with purifying brightness.
Although a fierce foe to Bretonnia's enemies, Knights should be wary of their kleptomaniac tendencies…
A ferocious hunger drives axe-wielding Minotaurs into the melee - hunger for war and hunger for flesh.
Countless forays into the ever-dangerous realm of the fey bordering their homeland has honed these Knights’ skills.
These archers take aim at the enemies of the Elven kingdom, harassing with arrows whilst screening their allies.
Favoured by Caledor, these raiders bring oblivion to Ulthuan's enemies, by spear-tipped charge.
Most Sorceresses of Ghrond lurk in the utter darkness, but there are those who walk close to the light still, using illusions to spin cruel visions and tricks to get the souls they desire.
A monolithic force of destruction on the battlefield - each tremendous footstep crushing many foolish warriors underfoot.
A Savage Orc, atop his boar, delivers a powerful charge then remains a mighty, fearful presence at the heart of the battle.
With a weapon in each hand, these Gors lunge and slash at anything before them with predictably wild abandon.
Former grave wardens of the abbey who fight alongside Grail Knights, yearning to accrue relics and slivers of their glory.
With shields in hand, these Ungors can engage the enemy and hold their own thereafter.
The monotonal drones of their crude pipes announce the arrival of the most savage, rowdy, undisciplined, and deadly.
At all times these beautiful warriors accompany the Everqueen, as her advisors and protectors.
A furious battlefield force; savage in combat and notoriously difficult to kill.
He who undertakes the quest must never flinch and never waver, until at last he finds the sacred Grail, and sups.
Fearsome Saurus marked for greatness by the Old Ones.
The air erupts with contagion and ruin, choking the enemy's lungs and savaging their bodies.
The air erupts with contagion and ruin, choking the enemy's lungs and savaging their bodies.
A Great Shaman summons the power of Gork and Mork, ravaging any in his way.
The Chill of Sontar is a ruthless killing machine.
Kroq-Gar is the last survivor of ruined Xhotl, from a spawning that was always marked for greatness.
Kroq-Gar is the last survivor of ruined Xhotl, from a spawning that was always marked for greatness.
Kroq-Gar is the last survivor of ruined Xhotl, from a spawning that was always marked for greatness.
Kroq-Gar is the last survivor of ruined Xhotl, from a spawning that was always marked for greatness.
The elite of Montfort’s low-born, saddled castle defenders often sent out to harass besiegers with their noxious arrows.
Power, achieved through intimidation and strength on the battlefield; fear instils loyalty.
Power, achieved through intimidation and strength on the battlefield; fear instils loyalty.
Power, achieved through intimidation and strength on the battlefield; fear instils loyalty.
Power, achieved through intimidation and strength on the battlefield; fear instils loyalty.
Power, achieved through intimidation and strength on the battlefield; fear instils loyalty.
A piercing scream, a swooping shadow upon the water – a dead body drained of blood.
Galloping to war with Orion, his personal guard bring a calamity to all who stand against them.
The dwellers of the White Tower use High Magic to destroy enemies and augment allies.
Trained to fight in tight formations, Ironbreakers form a living line of defence, letting enemies crash over them.
These rabid beasts are the ideal raiding companions, more vicious in death than they ever were in life.
The interred remains of Knights are defended violently by those whose existence gives them purpose.
The victims of a Minotaur are ripped limb from limb and then, unfortunately, devoured.
The Cold Ones upon which they ride instinctively recognise the same cold-blooded cunning within the hearts of these consummate warriors.
Pernicious and sly, Skarsnik retains command through deception, subterfuge and no small amount of murder.
Strong Kroxigors marked for greatness by the Old Ones.
Keen and sharp, these Dwarfs know every nook, every cranny of the mountains.
Ungors are more nimble than their brethren, useful for flanking foes and harassing with spears.
Ghyran - the Lore of Life - is used on the battlefield to heal their allies and frustrate the enemy's designs.
These Slann mystics bring ruin to the foe's armies and devastation to its cities.
The Mages of Saphery excel at all forms of magic; the spells of shadows and illusion are no exception.
Walls are nothing to the blast of trebuchet fire, and a man's skull fares even worse.
Grotesque and withered, Necrarchs may be weaker in combat, but their magical prowess is second to none.
Cunning Skinks marked for greatness by the Old Ones.
More brutish than other Bestigor herds, the Manrippers can resist the charge of the most colossal opponents.
Everything about him is bent to that one great task of holding back evil.
Indomitable Stegadons marked for greatness by the Old Ones.
Loyal followers of the Everchosen, maleficent Knights dedicated with reverent faith to any and all of the Chaos Gods.
This Hellhammer Cannon has been refined by the Pirate King himself to be one of the most feared artillery pieces in existence.
The Empire's standard, effective cannonry sends armour-piercing iron balls ploughing through enemy ranks with devastating aplomb.
A hippogryph is no easy prize, but its power in battle makes the effort to tame one worth it.
Only the purest of heart may serve the Everqueen.
Ever seeking vengeance, these hardy Rangers follow their Brewmaster, delivering grim tidings of upcoming struggles and bolstering the Dwarfs’ defensive lines.
Such weapons require little more skill than the ability to point and shoot - even the smallfolk can be trusted with their use.
The Heralds are renowned for their ability to read the ebb and flow of battle.
The Amber Wizard commands the Lore of Beasts, ranging the forces of nature itself against the enemy.
Firm allies for millennia, these majestic birds aid the Elves by swooping onto enemy lines and clawing them apart.
Undead minions have no fear of blowing themselves up, making them ideal gunpowder-keg-launchers!
Within these living, walking timbers, the souls of great Elven warriors wield powers of incendiary magic.
The strongest of souls gather the forest around them and are reborn as instruments of its defence.
The Tomb Kings know nothing but rage and the desire to reclaim their lost kingdoms.
Using his seer-craft, the Shaman-Sorcerer wrangles the Winds to guide the tribe towards war.
Hurling itself into the fray, the pack's teeth close around limbs and do not let go.
Though temperamental, a successful Razorgor Chariot charge causes horrendous damage to the enemy line.
These incarnations of Khaine strike fear in to all those who stand before them.
Little humanity remains within the Forsaken, only a desire for battle, followed by a furious charge into the fray.
Pity the unfortunate facing such a device - they will need every ounce of wit and fighting ability to prevail against it.
A gargantuan, annihilative force of nature, unnaturally brought back from death to wreak yet more death.
Desire for the Gods' attention demands these men fight in the melee with strength far beyond that of mere mortals.
Riding a Squig is a dangerous, foolish business. Goblins, however, are better riders than most, so live slightly longer.
These crude machines hurl rocks with such fury, their targets feel as if Gork himself was assaulting them.
“’Good’? I spit on ‘good’! I desire only power, and you watch, for I shall have it!”
When the lodestone bell rings, dark magic exudes and ripples across the battlefield.
The power that she wields, both on and off the battlefield, shapes the course of nations.
Supreme Sorceresses wield powerful magic that lesser mortals can only dream of.
Chariots are best employed to deliver destructive charges to the enemy lines - over and over again.
Beware the dark, brutish shadows that dwell in the foggy depths of the marsh!
Kholek Suneater is beyond all mortal reckoning. His fury and strength, like his age, are immense. Truly, he is unstoppable.
Bearing the faces of Nehekhara’s illustrious pantheon, these Ushabti use spear-sized arrows – and the fear of the gods – to strike at the unfortunate foe.
Tremble at their imposing sight, run in vain from their mighty arrows.
Though these Dwarfs excel at a distance, it would be foolhardy to underestimate them in melee.
Young and impetuous, these Dragons dive down onto enemy ranks with exuberant fury, crushing foes like flies.
Raining slingshots down then vanishing again, too quickly to be caught; a frustrating nuisance to the foe.
Raining slingshots down then vanishing again, too quickly to be caught; a frustrating nuisance to the foe.
Fell deeds and dark ruin await those who dare to face the son of Gilles le Breton!
From atop skeletal mounts, death and destruction are dealt without contrition.
Warpstone fire belches forth, reducing targets to nothing more than bubbling, crusted blobs.
The random discharge of noisy, indiscriminate firepower gives the Gunnery Mob a small spark of satisfaction enjoyed in life.
All the Necrotects see now is purity besmirched. With a whipcrack they strive once more for perfection.
The bravest of the brave, the noble Lords of Bretonnia will fight for the Lady until the bitter, bloody end.
The Troll King seeks to grind the realms of civilisation under his monstrous rule.
Raining arrows from a distance is the preferred Greenskin tactic.
In the name of Khaine and with draichs in their hands, furious brutality is brought to the battlefield.
He follows those who wage war for the Dark Gods – their killing fields are his feeding grounds.
Cyclopean fiends, degenerate and malign, ever-vying for the attention of the Dark Gods.
A terrifying beast of myth and legend, emanating shrieks of the damned from the Ruinous Realm itself.
Even the wisest, most ancient of gentle spirits can be bent to violence by savage, unrelenting war.
No cave is too dark, no pathway too treacherous for the Ranger to scout and scour and know.
This Chaos Sorcerer employs dark and nefarious magics to tear through both body and mind.
Its destructive power cannot be overstated, the world illuminated by a turbulent battery of missile fire.
The only thing scarier than a Depth Guard is one with a weapon that gives it an eight-foot reach.
The Knights ride down their enemies with a thunderous charge and a cry of valour.
Amidst a churning cloud of heaved-up sand, these Undead warriors charge their foes with supernatural determination.
All Dwarfs complain, all Longbeards moan, but none gripe and fight half as much as these courageous old gits.
Feeding on a banquet of flesh tossed into their dire-furnaces, these Hellcannons fire bolts of devastating energy towards distant enemies.
Wielding powers seemingly tantamount to Necromancy, these dark Wizards can leech and hex the souls of their enemies.
These riders never tire and can chase foes down over countless leagues, until their dying moment.
Wielding double-handed swords and wearing heavy plate, Greatswords are a potent elite unit with an impressive melee strength.
Crypt Ghouls are barely sentient but they can fight, using their claws and makeshift weapons to rip men apart.
The greatest of Runesmiths rides into battle atop the Anvil of Doom, smiting all foes with magical fury.
The Shadow Warriors of Nagarythe are grim soldiers who fight for revenge alone.
The earth speaks and the Bray-Shaman hears it. Nature flows through him, giving him mastery over the land itself.
Wurrzag is beholden to no tribe nor lord, only the whisperings of the Greenskin gods in his addled mind.
The glow of the rock exacerbates its curse, tormenting it with even more vivid visions than other Cygors.
An ancient lineage of warriors supremely enhanced by the energies of Chaos, nourished only by carnage and bloodshed.
The touch of an aged Phoenix is enough to freeze a warrior to death.
Mighty Saurus marked for greatness by the Old Ones.
The zealousness of the Forsaken is especially great in those reborn in the macabre paradise of the Garden of Nurgle.
Morghur does not care for the world as it is, preferring to remake it according to his ever-changing whims.
The keen eyes of Djaf’s Carrion can spot a meal - or an artillery target - over great distances.
This ancient, revered beast is a fearsome sight on the battlefield - their giant blowpipes causing much destruction.
Guardians of the sacred places of Avelorn, these peerless archers are incorruptible.
The definitive Wood Elf warriors within the armies of Athel Loren, bolstered by magical, poisoned arrow-tips for additional advantage.
In many ways, these warriors define the armies of Athel Loren - their bows and blades are at the forefront of any action.
Stalwarts of Athel Loren’s Elven armies, these bow and blade-armed warriors’ arrows burn with an enchanted flame to ignite flammable targets.
There is no bargaining when the forest is damaged; vengeance will be exacted.
Detestable Undead dragoons of the sea, risen to expedite vengeance in the form of giant pincers and rusty bullets.
Even the most heinous green-skinned scumbags look upon these Goblins' swift skulduggery with reverent horror.
Marked for greatness amidst an already-blessed spawning, these Skink Chiefs are the leaders of their red-crested legions.
Almost too much lizard for their Skink handlers to handle, there's almost no holding these natural predators back!
Agile and deadly in melee - an excellent first-response to impending threats.
The Swordsmen form a resolute battle line. Blades in hand, they thrive in melee, at the heart of battle.
A charge so devastating that it rends the flesh and bone from its victims.
These guards' loyalty in life was rewarded; now they are expected to show it once more.
A pack of Wolf Riders can appear from nowhere, strike with precision, and be away before the enemy knows what has happened.
Proficient hunters marked for greatness by the Old Ones.
Atop their venomous mounts, Goblin Riders can run down enemies with surprising precision.
A well-placed kennel of Warhounds, set loose on the enemy lines, can thread injury and debilitating poison amongst the enemy.
With a thunderous roll, a volley of devastating, armour-piercing fire is loosed.
More than a savage and destructive beast, Khazrak has a keen mind for strategy combined with animal cunning and guile.
Defenders of Cothique and chosen by the Lord of the Deeps himself.
Unlike other levied citizen militias, the Lothern Sea Guard remain armed and ready at all times.
Unlike other levied citizen militias, the Lothern Sea Guard remain armed and ready at all times.
Prideful - and all the more deadly for it - the Boar Boyz deal grizzly death from atop their mounts.
Fortunately, the smallfolk can be fielded in such numbers that the handgun's lack of accuracy and tendency to explode does little to blunt their attack.
Unblemished, frozen in time, pristine - the skin-deep appearance of Sigvald belies a twisted, corrupted, vicious soul, hungry for destruction.
With pistol in hand and a furious desire to root out heresy, the Witch Hunter is a formidable fighter.
First come the vibrations; next the distant sound of destruction; finally, carnage is unleashed. Good luck.
Gors may be rank-and-file beasts, but that does not diminish their ferocity on the battlefield.
Scuttling across the battlefield, these killer arthropods want nothing less than to dismember and decapitate anything that comes near.
These Slann mystics bring ruin to the foe's armies and devastation to its cities.
The Vampire Lord takes to melee with power and growing madness, both on foot and atop monstrous, powerful mounts.
Though temperamental and difficult to control, a Troll is a whirling ball of difficult-to-kill death.
Maddened by dank mould and mushrooms, a Goblin Shaman hurls debilitating spells into the enemy's ranks with chaotic abandon.
Only the strongest spawnings, in both mind and body, are fit to guard the Old Ones' Star Chambers.
The Dwarfs of Clan Norgrimling are determined to see their enemies wiped out with a whoosh of scalding, cleansing steam.
Giants attack the enemy in a rage, with flailing limbs that break both man and machine apart.
This beast's bite brings not just pain, but also a cruel toxicity that courses through every vein.
Flame Cannons belch burning pitch across the battlefield, raining molten death upon the enemy.
High Elves have been studying the night skies long before the astromancers of the Empire, and so can freely manipulate the Wind of Azyr.
A Minotaur, with axe in hand, can hold its own against dozens of enemies with vicious, brutal fury.
Night Goblins raid with efficiency; they swarm and ambush, cutting their foes apart.
The pickaxe is not the mightiest Dwarfen weapon, but explosives even things out somewhat.
A colossal walking frame of galleon-torn timber, iron, and man-flesh, relentlessly driven by a vortex of deathly energy.
More reliable than others of their class, a blowpipe-primed unit can fell scores of unsuspecting enemies.
These mighty savages are armed and armoured by design; woe betide any being who encroaches on their territory!
From atop enormous and reverent Stegadons, their crew fire enormous bolts from giant crossbows, decimating enemy ranks.
Agile and swift beyond measure, these mounted warriors' missiles spell doom for their opponents.
Swift and deadly, these mounted archers use arrows dipped in poison and charged with magic to weaken and slow their targets.
Death's true face radiates sinister magic; the cruel laughter of ancient gods echoes within its shadow.
Extremely effective in battle, the Cairn Wraith has no corporeal form, making it extremely difficult to kill with conventional weaponry.
A Chaos Chariot is a terrifying thing to slam into an enemy line, punching through with maddening strength.
Slayers are elite units with a thirst for death, fighting hard in melee until the enemy dies, or they do.
Trained to trample on command, a Mammoth can easily reduce enemies to a bloody ground-smear.
The strongest, meanest Beastmen, Bestigors seek out elite foes to slaughter and dominate.
Although inaccurate, Peasant Bowmen provide a cheap, plentiful line of defence against the oncoming enemy.
This millennia-old Shaggoth has little on its mind other than destroying entire tribes of men with its deadly lightning storms.
A bolt in the eye is a terrible way to die, and the calling card of the Bolt-fiends.
Longbeards are veteran fighters of many wars, most resolute in their shieldwall and grumpiest in spirit.
Longbeards are veteran fighters of many wars, rending armour with the two-handed az and cleaving opponents in two.
Balefiends revel in the instability they create between worlds, urging the Dark Gods to favour the Fimir once again.
The Flag of the Blood Keep flashes violently; the Blood Knights run their enemies down.
Lord of Undeath, this mighty Champion of Chaos defies mortality once more to defeat his enemies across time.
Horse-born leaders, their powerful steeds a symbol of dread status before the Dark Gods.
Monstrous, mutated and savage, a Crypt Horror is devastating against the enemy frontline.
Their bolts strike with such force that, should their targets survive, they are unfit to live even as slaves.
The charge will fall upon them and be repelled by resolute hands bearing resolute polearms.
Watch as the foe throws itself upon these warriors' spears. Those who survive must then face shield and claw.
The Prophet seeks to deliver Lustria from its beleaguerment by way of the only tribute acceptable to Sotek – prodigious sacrifice!
The Necrolith Colossi are great bestriding monuments, often in the shape of hulking skeletons.
Great weapons increase the chances that the ambitious, yet lowly, Marauder may ensnare the attention of the Gods.
Chaos Warriors come alive in the midst of bloody battle; thriving on the slaughter of similar foes.
Broadside cannons for sinking mortal ships are devastating when used in the field, pulverising living flesh and solid walls.
Spearmen provide the backbone of the Empire's battle line, a defensive row of spears against the enemy charge.
These Marauders use a wall of spears to impale their enemies, ever in the hope of Ruinous exaltation.
With a swish of their lethal, poisoned tails, the foe is rendered paralysed and helpless, to be consumed by ravening jaws.
The greatest warrior the High Elves have ever known, eschewing dreams of kingship for glory in battle.
The greatest warrior the High Elves have ever known, eschewing dreams of kingship for glory in battle.
A loathsome beast of uncharted depths possessing colossal strength and insatiable hunger.
This vicious beast carries a warshrine aloft, carrying blasphemous icons and unholy relics to battle in sight of the Chaos Gods.
A Captain of the Empire is a Hero, a specialist in melee who leads by his courageous example.
The foremost airborne defender of the temple-cities is peerless in his vigilance and daring, timing aerial assaults to deadly perfection.
The way of fire is nothing compared to the fluid power of metal!
These noble sons from the High Realms of Athel Loren practice the art of war with obsession.
The Warriors of Nehekhara remember only their duty to their king, and pursue his enemies with ruthless purpose.
The Emerald Gate - one of the wonders of the Old World - is guarded only by the best of the best.
A lumbering Giant is the terror of the battlefield, smashing entire ranks of men aside and feasting on the less fortunate ones.
The Thane leads Dwarfs to battle with a cry of vengeance and an unstoppable rage.
Backed up by his Black Orc bodyguard "Da Immortulz", Grimgor is "Da Best" - the brutal will of Gork made manifest.
Tretch's formidable repertoire of underhanded skills, combined with his famously good luck, has led to a number of legendary deeds!
Tethered to their mounts by a sharp hook, the other mummified hand wields a barbed staff to carve through mortal flesh.
Nobody knows what the crown is or where it is from, but through it Azhag gains clairvoyance and power.
Bolstering the fighting spirit of all those around it and blasting enemy ranks with savage, dark energy.
Rifles afford better accuracy, which can be advantageous for the clumsy hands of the rotting Undead.
All Karaks are defended with vigour, but none hold the line with as much determination as these hammer-wielding guards.
Half-mad, swinging their censers violently and damning all those nearby to a pestilent demise.
Up close, a Troll will batter foes into submission or vomit disgusting and potently corrosive bile across the field.
Although diminutive by Beastmen standards, Ungors are both faster and more nimble than others of their kind.
Until their targets lie dead and bullet-riddled, there is no rest for the Salt Lord’s wicked assailants of the skies.
Dishevelled and mange-ridden, these wolves (and their riders) are savage beasts all the same.
The most experienced riders atop some of the least controllable beasts in existence? Prepare to meet your death!
The Lore of Fire imbues Bright Wizards with the power to call searing fire and burning death upon those who oppose them.
This great beast has both the temperament and strength to bear the Engines of the Gods to battle and beyond.
The spear and shield of the Wood Elves, seldom bested in combat.
Beneath the fortress of boughs, Athel Loren is defended with blood.
Matured and wise, they savage enemy battlelines with claws and fearsome flames.
High Elf aristocrats are precise and calculating, and they bring this nature to the battlefield.
High Elf aristocrats are precise and calculating, and they bring this nature to the battlefield.
High Elf aristocrats are precise and calculating, and they bring this nature to the battlefield.
An erratic flurry of explosive airborne destruction - Helstorm rockets are extremely powerful, if extremely unreliable, weapons from the Empire's arsenal.
High Elf aristocrats are precise and calculating, and they bring this nature to the battlefield.
High Elf aristocrats are precise and calculating, and they bring this nature to the battlefield.
The keeper of the arcane lore casts terrible curses, summoning vengeful desert spirits to feast upon their souls.
Terrifyingly ravenous mockeries of life, bound into monstrous groups with arcane spells.
Savage Orc Arrer Boyz aren't always precise but remain deadly. Precisely deadly, you might say.
Alarielle the Radiant, High Priestess of Isha and Everqueen of Ulthuan.
Potions, poisons, and words of power, to affect weak minds or strike their owners down.
Potions, poisons, and words of power, to affect weak minds or strike their owners down.
The pickaxe is not the mightiest Dwarfen weapon, but it serves with relative success in melee.
High Elf aristocrats are precise and calculating, and they bring this nature to the battlefield.
High Elf aristocrats are precise and calculating, and they bring this nature to the battlefield.
High Elf aristocrats are precise and calculating, and they bring this nature to the battlefield.
High Elf aristocrats are precise and calculating, and they bring this nature to the battlefield.
This Chaos Sorcerer can create a whirling storm of blades and destruction to bring ruin to his foes.
This majestic helm has been worn by every Slayer King since the time of King Baragor!
These men wade into battle with conventional weapons, but can also call powerful magical forces to decimate their enemies.
The eldest of the fabled First Generation and the original Relic Priest, Kroak labours tirelessly to further the Great Plan.
The Elves of the Grey have battled ceaselessly for generations, and will continue that tradition for generations to come.
Hollow-eyed murderers, the Doomfire Warlocks must loosen the grip of Slaanesh with the blood of others.
Who dares damage my engines!
What is death but an obstacle to be overcome? There is no true death beneath the eternal night.
The Deckhands’ polearms are rusty extensions of the decomposing arms that brandish them.
Driven not by skill, but by a desire to feast on flesh, Zombies are good, terrifying fodder in melee.
These Lizardmen riders swoop down upon the enemy lines to harass them from above.
These Lizardmen riders swoop down upon the enemy lines to harass them from above.
Though powerful enough in battle, a Goblin Boss can also employ all manner of trickery to ensure victory.
The skilled Gyrocopter pilot unleashes jets of steam upon unprepared battle lines.
The Brimstone Gun gives the Gyrocopter pilot a more accurate and lethal tool, ideal for obliterating the target completely!
With az in hand, Dwarfen warriors lay into the front lines with unremitting violence.
The Hammer of the Witches, fired with righteous purpose, smites evil with thunderous, armour-shattering blasts.
Atop their skeletal steeds, Black Knights destroy enemy battle lines with powerful cavalry charges.
Disciplined and merciless, it is a pleasure to watch the Hellebronai work.
The most ancient of Dragons, they destroy the foe with a power that can halt Chaos itself.
Armed with a mighty lance for a powerful charge, then enchanted swords to deliver punishment up close.
Their charge protected by heavy barding, these mounted warriors wield mighty blades to slash and gore.
Stronger and faster than the mightiest warhorse, the Pegasus Knight swoops across the battlefield with a powerful airborne charge.
This 'Living Bastion' has few predators save the terrain it must traverse, making it the ideal conveyor for the Ark of Sotek itself.
From horseback, these Yeomen bring death across the battlefield to where it's needed most.
Ferocious Carnosaurs marked for greatness by the Old Ones.
The Lord commander wades into battle, cutting foes apart and setting an example for the rest of the army.
Archery from horseback is fast and dangerous to the enemy, who have little time to react.
Betrayed and outcast by their peers, they bring savage vengeance to any who cross them.
The twin blades of these spurned Elves are brought to bear with truly brutal results.
The strength of these spiteful warriors is borne out by the horrific power of their weapons.
Patchwork creations of pure brawn and unthinking rage, they charge with the desire only to destroy.
The holy relics of the Lady, the most sacred in all Bretonnia, are guarded by the most fervent and fearsome of warriors.
Though clumsy, Centigors can still lodge a throwing axe deep into an enemy skull from afar.
These Slann mystics bring ruin to the foe's armies and devastation to its cities.
Malekith has done much and risked much more to achieve dominion; he will do more still…
Malekith has done much and risked much more to achieve dominion; he will do more still…
Malekith has done much and risked much more to achieve dominion; he will do more still…
Malekith has done much and risked much more to achieve dominion; he will do more still…
A bunch of sneaky, venal, stabby gits - a suitably befitting bodyguard for the treacherous Warlord of the Eight Peaks.
The bravest of warriors, Paladins charge into battle either mounted or on foot, bringing righteous death in the Lady's name.
To control animals and twist their natural aggression to your own ends shows true mastery of your art.
Chosen are greater than their Chaotic brethren, more powerful and savage in close quarters, especially with great weapons.
In a society as corrupt and perfidious as this, the law-makers must be protected from those over whom they rule.
The sight of the Storm Riders' banners strikes fear in to the hearts of even the most merciless Druchii.
Untamed Cold Ones are far too unpredictable to be ridden into battle; simply point them at the foe and stay out of their way!
All High Elves, both highborn and low, must defend Ulthuan to the last.
From afar, Arrer Boyz rain down arrows upon their enemies. Accuracy be damned, quantity is all.
Though frail, the power of his knowledge and tactical thought is mighty indeed.
Though frail, the power of his knowledge and tactical thought is mighty indeed.
These ludicrously long-barrelled guns require two Skaven to operate effectively, though safety be damned!
The savage desert itself obeys the one who summons the dunes and the dead to fight for him.
A Centigor charges the enemy battle line, great weapon in hand, delivering oblivion to its foes.
These reanimated Norscans are Unliving proof that Manann’s will can be manifested from death as well as life.
The air erupts with contagion and ruin, choking the enemy's lungs and savaging their bodies.
The air erupts with contagion and ruin, choking the enemy's lungs and savaging their bodies.
Moving just as swiftly on land as in the water, these giant, predatory reptiles spit corrosive venom before closing in for the kill.
Cunning, devious and powerful, Mannfred von Carstein sees all before him as prizes to be claimed.
The mother of the Witch King is more than a match for most other magic-users on the field.
The mother of the Witch King is more than a match for most other magic-users on the field.
The Great Horned Rat breathes pestilence through Skrolk, infecting the very world beneath his fetid feet.
Existing only to serve, the Hawk-God’s blessed archers deliver his swift justice – a rain of death from above – long after their own lives have ended.
Doooooooooooooooom! Muwahahahaha, yes-yes!
Night Goblins Fanatics are highly efficient killers – the ball and chain they wield sees to that!
Unseen on the battlefield, but felt when their deadly darts bring down enemies in their droves.
These wise, winged bastions of the forest will see it defended, as they have done for countless centuries.
The daughter of Manann himself is the most feared captain in Sartosa, as merciless as an ocean tempest.
A weapon from the College of Light, vaporising their enemies by channelling the Wind of Hysh.
The bigger the blade, the greater the chance the fickle, Dark Gods will notice the aspiring Champion.
These Skinks are differentiated by their impressive red crests, but are also stronger and cleverer than their lesser cousins.
The cornerstone of the Skaven military, less numerous but better trained than the slave class.
The cornerstone of the Skaven military, less numerous but better trained than the slave class.
Orion is the Wood Elves; he is the Winds; he is Athel Loren itself.
Plagued by visions, Cygors are cursed to see the Winds of Chaos. Naturally, this makes them mad and extremely dangerous.
Called forth by the Horn of the Ancestors, ready to once again slay the foes of the Karaz Ankor.
Unspeakable evil energy is exuded, both empowering the Undead legions and crippling those who stand against them.
A pack of Chaos Warhounds charging, full of bloodlust and with jaws wide, creates no purer sense of terror.
Hideously mutated and filled with hungry rage, Razorgors tear men apart in their search for food.
Helblaster Guns eviscerate opposition from a distance with a ceaseless shower of black powder fire.
Where the Crowfather treads, mayhem and destruction always follow close behind.
placeholder
Angry, teeming rats with spears to overwhelm, defend, and tear enemies from their mounts.
Although fury and numbers count for much in a fight, a good shield cannot be overstated.
Anticipating the will of Skarsnik, this crack squad of Goblin nutters undertakes whatever devious chicanery is required to achieve victory.
Skeletal steeds instinctively obey the will of their riders, displaying the same supernatural discipline.
The Grail Knights charge the enemy line with a furious stampede of hooves and the Lady in their thoughts.
The greatest way to deliver toxic scourge is to hurl it at the enemy from a very safe distance!
Venerated Lizardmen leaders, they exact brutal vengeance upon enemies and trespassers alike.
Venerated Lizardmen leaders, they exact brutal vengeance upon enemies and trespassers alike.
Venerated Lizardmen leaders, they exact brutal vengeance upon enemies and trespassers alike.
Like their mistress, the Blades of the Blood Queen glory in bloodshed.
The ichor of the Gods flows through the veins of those from the God-touched wilderness.
The trebuchet - far superior to the catapult - hurls thrice-blessed stones at the enemy, crushing them with devout fury.
Each serpentine steed is spurred to acts of great brutality in the name of the king.
This Chaos Sorcerer wields the Winds of Magic, using the power of death to tear limb from limb with a gesture.
Holding the line against the enemy charge, braced with shields and fierce with primordial determination.
The standard, hardy warriors of the Lizardmen battleline. Their clubs are inelegant, but effective.
Their titles acquired by taking them from others, their savagery against the foe is just as unremitting.
Their titles acquired by taking them from others, their savagery against the foe is just as unremitting.
The spear is a solid weapon; piercing and defensive. Goblins, however…
The Miners of Mount Bloodhorn fight in memory of their fallen Hold with unmatched passion and fury.
The Master Runesmith stands by his Lord – his kin – one last time before the gods.
Chaos Knights deliver a terrifyingly powerful charge to enemy lines, particularly if armed with a lance.
With singular determination, Mazdamundi will enact the Great Plan - the complete extermination of the unfit races!
With singular determination, Mazdamundi will enact the Great Plan - the complete extermination of the unfit races!
The rarest of all steeds, only the most noble of Bretonnians ride these dignified, sophisticated creatures into battle.
The Lore of Light banishes the forces of darkness and evil to protect its adherents, and their allies, from harm.
Between bow shots, the Night Goblin Archers send their Fanatic hostages forth to cause mayhem.
Power, achieved through intimidation and strength on the battlefield; fear instils loyalty.
Power, achieved through intimidation and strength on the battlefield; fear instils loyalty.
Power, achieved through intimidation and strength on the battlefield; fear instils loyalty.
Power, achieved through intimidation and strength on the battlefield; fear instils loyalty.
Power, achieved through intimidation and strength on the battlefield; fear instils loyalty.
By Khorne, by Tzeentch, Nurgle and Slaanesh, let the world come crashing down!
The Blood Knights of the sea are elite, armour-clad sentries to the dreaded seafaring creatures of the night.
Zombies: shuffling, mindless, ambling towards their foes - on an unending quest for flesh.
The Manticore is a killer, above all. Born of Chaos, mutations and madness, but a killer all the same.
As wicked as she is learned, no mortal can harm the Unliving Countess of Sylvania, for she reigns eternal!
A staple of Dwarfen armies, the cannon is a long-ranged, powerful weapon essential to the Dwarfen grand strategy.
Enacting the will of their Slann overlords, magical fury is unleashed upon the Old Ones' foes.
The noble-born warriors of the Empire fight in Knightly Orders, heroic brotherhoods who ride into battle atop mighty barded warhorses.
Those with knowledge may summon great gusts of wind or fearsome arcs of lightning to harass their enemies.
High Elf aristocrats are precise and calculating, and they bring this nature to the battlefield.
High Elf aristocrats are precise and calculating, and they bring this nature to the battlefield.
High Elf aristocrats are precise and calculating, and they bring this nature to the battlefield.
High Elf aristocrats are precise and calculating, and they bring this nature to the battlefield.
High Elf aristocrats are precise and calculating, and they bring this nature to the battlefield.
With riders as deadly as their mounts, the Knights of the Ebon Claw are a force to be reckoned with.
What a Mortar may lack in sheer stopping power compared to cannons, it makes up with pure vicious, explosive destruction.
More rudimentary than the cannon, a Grudge Thrower is still an effective long-range weapon against enemy infantry.
Goblin Archers can pepper the enemy from afar, with varying success.
One incensed Squig is enough trouble. For whosoever attracts their ire, an entire herd conjures a nightmare!
The bow is as natural to the High Elves as breathing; each shot is a masterpiece of death from afar.
The bow is as natural to the High Elves as breathing; each shot is a masterpiece of death from afar.
The notorious tinker-rat known as Ikit Claw focuses his diabolical pursuits on building the most heinous killing-contraptions possible.
This particular spikey ball of cyclic death is the very bane of the Dwarfen race, whose little legs cannot carry themselves away fast enough!
A thundering mix of beast and machine to harass enemy battlelines from range before crushing them at the charge.
Equipped with the best armour and weapons, Reiksguard deliver a powerful charge, then remain amongst the throng to continue fighting.
At the heart of the battle, in the thickest fighting, highly-trained and utterly silent.
The Witch King is defended, at halberd-point, from those who would do him harm. Imagine such a thing!
Only the most basic memory survives: to fight, and better than their other Undead cohorts.
Cold-blooded in more ways than one, this flying killer waits to pounce from behind the blinding blizzard.
Some are drawn to war by the need for vengeance, fighting fiercely to sate their bloodlust.
When the souls are released, they endeavour not to return without new victims to torment for eternity.
“The emptinessss… the hunger… if only I could be warm again… it’s all I think of between dark, waking dreamsss.”
An eldritch horror, the mad thrashing of its unnatural limbs sends all to their doom.
The path to Ruinous glory is strewn with the butchered remains of those who fell by the wayside.
True to their name, they wither their enemies with volleys of black-tipped arrows.
True to their name, they wither their enemies with volleys of black-tipped arrows.
This Sorcerer Lord gleans his power from death itself, consigning his opponents to endless, tormented oblivion.
From great range, a Steam Tank launches powerful shots of armour-piercing cannon fire with tremendous stopping power.
All champions strive to be chosen, willing their deeds to be observed and judged.
“No Troll, no Orc, no sneaky grobi scum shall bar my path. This time…”
Centuries of shame in defeat shall be washed away ‘neath my hammer; Clan Angrund will rise again!
The heinous combination of a Fell Bat and a gun-wielding zombie makes for a hideous, flying horror.
Drifting between the living and the dead, a Master Necromancer summons Undead minions to fight enemies on his behalf.
Marauders are the rank and file of Norscan armies, perfectly placed in the centre of battle, bloodied weapon in hand.
This shadowy tide of poisonous, scaly reptiles rarely tire and are always hungry. Always.
The diligent workforce of the Lizardmen Empire, good for throwing into melee as fodder.
These Skinks are trained to hurl javelins true enough to blunt a charging foe.
Gifted warriors, whose skill at arms is matched by their intelligence and grasp of magic.
Though not noble or powerful like Knights, these men take great honour to take up arms in defence of home.
You see… only your imminent death, haha, yes-yes!
Infernal flames belch from dismal braziers, permeating the air with fragments of magic-confounding Warpstone.
The mighty deeds of the Fireborn are spoken of in hushed tones by all the princes of Caledor.
The rarely-appearing Phoenix matriarch is a creature of Hekarti, awoken into this world through the heart of a raging volcano.
Appearing as if from the earth itself, peppering opponents with relentless, deadly sling-fire.
These secretive warriors work best when deployed away from the main host, striking at flanks and unsecured or vulnerable places.
Through life, death, and Undeath, the first and greatest of the Vampire Counts pursues the throne; it is his by right!
Those who are not gored by the rolling spikes of this beast chariot are thrown to a clumsy, painful demise.
Alith Anar is the Shadow King, a revenant who seeks the grisly death of every Dark Elf in retribution for Malekith’s sins.
The Liche Lord, ancient beyond memory, wanders the deserts in search of powerful artefacts to restore his beloved kingdom to its former glory.
When deadly Asrai spears are wielded, the war dance is an intricate performance ending in the foes' death.
Floating and weaving through the battle line; an expressive demonstration of violence.
Necromancers summon the dead to fight for them, hurling risen cadavers to join the fray in their name.
Mighty, hulking reptiles, these 'Living Bastions' are wild and untamed. Better watch out!
Carried atop the mightiest of beasts, the Revivification Crystal regenerates and heals combat-damaged units.
The Solar Engine can disintegrate enemies with a beam of pure sunlight.
The faceless God of the Underworld guides dead souls to the other life – some at the price of their service in battle.
The thudding crossbow bolts pack a punch that can bring down most foes.
Settra ruled over the most magnificent realm ever known; now he will see it restored.
Death stalks all that come to Ghrond, and those who wield the power of Shyish are more adept than most in murder's arcane arts.
Fast and dependable, an Outrider can be in one place to fire, then be in another to fire again moments later.
…and Hell, quite literally, followed with it.
Nagash must rise, or our realms of silence will fall.
From a position of relative safety, slings enable them to watch their peers march to their doom.
With savage claws and malicious temperament, to rip through enemies with grim delight.
A Vampire reduced and twisted to savagery, Vargheists swoop in from above and rip battle lines to pieces.
More stalwart and powerful than even the riders atop them, demigryphs deliver a monstrous charge into enemy battle lines.
Feeling no pain, they throw themselves into battle, paying little heed to what awaits them.
Cloaked in the power of the beast, the Bray-Shaman uses his primal mutations to exert greater strength.
The keenest eyes, the sharpest reflexes, the coldest of hearts.
The stuff of legend, devastating enemy lines with a staggering charge.
With stout shields and resolute temperaments, resisting the charge of any who dare stand against them.
Understanding from the outset that yours is a suicide mission focuses the murine mind on the murderous task at hand.
Little more than shuffling bones with swords and spears, Skeletons perform a dutiful, if not exemplary, job in the battle lines.
The Sisters of Slaughter are creatures of instinct, impossible to predict and unfathomably deadly.
Shamans practise the art of annoyance - peppering their enemies with frustrating, painful and distracting spells.
The sisters specialise in the three D's: doom, death and destruction.
Weapons bursting with dark energy, Wight Kings are monstrous fighters, more powerful than a dozen lesser ghouls.
These men are possessed, packing a decisive punch with a touch of insanity.
The hardest-hitting mobs in a tribe, Big 'Uns are well placed in melee, where they happily smash their enemies apart.
The terror of Bogenhafen leaves nothing living in its wake, driven by a dark appetite for murder and destruction.
The Soul-Eater brothers are bigger, stronger, and angrier than regular Cygors, needing little provocation to start hurling their boulders indiscriminately.
An unearthly mixture of wood, metal and bone to savage the foe in rending, powerful strikes.
From the chariot's elevated platform, archers are offered unparalleled opportunities to fire on the enemy.
Chariots deliver devastating charges to the front lines; the wolf steeds that draw them are ferocious in battle.
Savage Orcs alone are a terrifying prospect to face. Add Big 'Uns to the mix and things get really nasty very quickly.
Although new, and therefore suspect, a Thunderer's handgun can punch through the heaviest of armour at short range.
These crack Jezzail operators are the most accurate among their already-deadly kind; best keep your head down if you value your eyesight!
Hybrid man-beasts, raging at fate, Centigors bring their anger to bear upon anything in their path.
Death stalks all that come to Ghrond, and those who wield the power of Shyish are more adept than most in murder's arcane arts.
Where he hunts, the air is alive with poison darts, fired seemingly from nowhere at all.
These Irondrakes wield drakeguns that fire the deadly Trollhammer Torpedo - a spiky cone of death - at unfortunate foes.
Where he hunts, the air is alive with poison darts, fired seemingly from nowhere at all.
Where he hunts, the air is alive with poison darts, fired seemingly from nowhere at all.
Where he hunts, the air is alive with poison darts, fired seemingly from nowhere at all.
A hippogryph is no easy prize, but its power in battle makes the effort to tame one worth it.
The Hellcannon has a deadly sentience, firing bolts of eldritch fury over great distances.
Fell Bats fall upon their enemies in a seething mass; in numbers, they become overwhelming.
Like the Bloody Reaver upon which they serve, the Deck Guard are forged with the powerful magic of Noctilus himself.
This massive, multi-headed menace of dense scales can maul many victims at once, and does so with a terrifying ravenousness.
Defeat and conquest, at the end of a quarrel.
The cut and thrust of melee is child's play to those trained on tumultuous seas.
The powerful Sorcerer Lord summons up pillars of flame that sear the enemy to their very core.
Hexwraiths charge, spectral, through mountains in search of their prey - a battle line is a trifling thing for their devastating attack.
The rarest of all steeds, only the most noble of Bretonnians ride these dignified, sophisticated creatures into battle.
This Sorcerer Lord can reach into the very minds of his adversaries, ripping thoughts apart as easily as undoing a knot.
With axe-flinging Marauders in tow, drooling and crazed Ice Wolves can pull chariots with overwhelming speed.
The bulk of Dark Elf armies, with spears as unwavering as their pride.
The hiss of the Vampire Admiral’s orders spurs an Undead crew to enact their master’s sinister will.
A boar-mounted Savage Orc Big ‘Un has a powerful charge and a really unpleasant line in melee skills.
Cunning overseers, whose job it is to manage and well, steal any credit that may be due an inventive Warlock Engineer.
Channelling her ancient, ageless fury, the Asp-Goddess’ chosen riders bite with her deadly venom.
Though their origins are shrouded in mystery, Vlad and his descendants now swarm across the world, bringing their gift of death to all!
The mightiest and most legendary of Feral Carnosaurs has roamed Lustria for centuries, devouring all unlucky enough to encounter it.
Emerging from the desert dust clouds, these horsemen come charging out of the storm, and death rides with them.
The icy northern reaches of frozen purgatory are haunted by howls of the ravenous.
Not just to command nature, but to range animals' primal rage against your foe? That is true power.
When the skies are dark and the need is great, these noble avians come to the aid of their Elven friends.
Although a fraction of the size of their fully-grown sisters, newly-hatched Arachnaroks are every bit as deadly.
The Shaggoth tower over the common man, casting fearsome shadows matched only by the seismic devastation they cause.
Much rarer than other Cold Ones, these virtually-extinct Lustrian warriors fight with preternatural swiftness that belies their size.
Though they hail from Clan Norgrimling, the fealty of these Ironbreakers is sworn to the glory of the Dwarfs.
Elite, hardened warriors, Hammerers thrive amongst the melee with warhammer in hand, smashing the unprepared to pieces.
When subjected to his power, all before this Sorcerer Lord are sliced, diced and desiccated .
Recognisably dark-furred, the Skaven military elite fight with a proud zeal unique to their class.
Recognisably dark-furred, the Skaven military elite fight with a proud zeal unique to their class.
With a team of Goblins upon its back, the Arachnarok's sheer enormity strikes fear into the hearts of all who face it.
Savage masters of the battlefield, Beastlords join the fray with axes in hand and death in mind.
Chaos Lords take their blood-drenched blades into battle. Fighting endlessly, they are merciless and unrelenting in the fray.
Their shields ensure that these riders can get in amongst the fray and remain there.
Fast and nimble, dodging enemy fire to deliver incisive hit-and-run charges to enemy lines.
Being everywhere and nowhere is their signature skill, with volleys of fire to harass the foe.
Crazed by poisonous concoctions, their dual daggers lacerate and shred for the Bloody-handed God.
The doom-bringing Krakenlord of Karond Kar fights as naturally as he reads the oceanic temper.
These silent sentinels guard the Shrine of Asuryan.
Shredded flaps of skin, clinging to a vicious humanoid wolf-thing, are all that remains of these former champions.
Beware the Deck Droppers’ black powder bombs released indiscriminately – if somewhat inaccurately – from above!
These desiccated husks remember how to shoot; a hail of endless death to thin the foe's numbers.
Schooled in slaughter through a lifetime of survival.
Walking, rotting Ogre flesh fused with ship debris and sea monsters makes for truly twisted abominations.
Former Champions with mutant gifts received in the Realm of Chaos itself, summoned back to terrorise the mortal world.
Pure muscle and rage, Warbosses devastate enemies with their brutal melee attacks.
A spear charge from atop a horde of Cold Ones will do significant damage to anyone in its path.
A pack of Cold Ones, ridden with skill, can charge powerfully into melee and remain there for some time.
These Undead mariners are competent crewmen and relentless fighters, making them ideal pirates.
The Irondrakes wield drakeguns, firing bursts of alchemical fury over anyone in their path.
It takes a certain kind of insanity to ride a rage-frothed Squig and bounce into the fray.
From above, the bomber pilot releases a payload of high-yield explosives that wreak havoc on enemy lines.
Volleys of withering fire reduce any would-be army to a riddled, desperate band.
Black Orcs are more disciplined, armoured and deadly than other Orcs, ripping through enemies with their heavy weapons for fun.
The mountains and caverns ring with Greenskin screams when these elite Gyrobombers unleash their payloads.
Ravenous beasts summoned from the Realm of Chaos itself, slobbering with an insatiable hunger to tear at living flesh.
Greenskins love chucking fings at the enemy; the rock lobber allows them to throw bigger fings further.
Halberdiers are stalwart defenders, able to hold the line behind a wall of Halberds, cutting enemies to ribbons.
Poisonous, corrosive venom dripping from her fearsome jaws, she first ensnares her victims in a web of dense, sticky silk.
Charged to defend the Phoenix King to the last, they cut their opponents down with their savage great axes.
Served by the reanimated corpses of shipwrecked unfortunates, the Pirate King is a plague upon the world’s seas.
Great warriors and doomseekers who have unsuccessfully found death thus far... even against Giants.
A volley of Dwarfen crossbow bolts will travel far and hit hard, particularly against the lightly armoured.
As well as commanding bands of Shadow Warriors, Shadow-walkers form an elite retinue of Nagarythe’s finest to accompany Alith Anar into battle.
What’s scarier than being bombarded with skulls from a distance? Why, if they are on fire and screaming in anguish of course!
Savage Orcs lay into their enemies with clubs, axes or whatever is needed to cause as much damage as possible.
When hoping for the fleeting, fickle favour of the Ruinous Ones, carry a really big mace.
Should the enemy get too close, an Organ Gun can decimate entire ranks with a well timed blast.
Greatest of all the Brides of Khaine, the many ways of murder are Hellebron's to command.
A pack of Dire Wolves is a lacerating mess of teeth in the melee, effective against enemy infantry.
Enacting the will of their Slann overlords, magical fury is unleashed upon the Old Ones' foes.
Enacting the will of their Slann overlords, magical fury is unleashed upon the Old Ones' foes.
Enacting the will of their Slann overlords, magical fury is unleashed upon the Old Ones' foes.
Enacting the will of their Slann overlords, magical fury is unleashed upon the Old Ones' foes.
In this lawless, miserable world the weak, or the merely out-manoeuvred, are either killed or put to back-breaking toil by the strong.
The Pistoliers are standard ranged cavalry, their pistols packing an effective punch whilst maintaining mobility.
Wielding her cursed cutlass, this swashbuckling Vampire cripples and kills all who dare oppose her.
A spear may mean they fight a little longer or better, but it only delays their inevitable demise.
The very latest technology Clan Skryre have to offer requires a special breed of suicidal nutters to operate it effectively.
Ignominious defeat at perfidious Skaven hands has only strengthened the already-steely resolve of Chaqua's surviving Saurus.
When a grudge-writ rock is unavailable, live Goblin ammunition is just as good.
Monsters of mutated chaos, these altered beasts rain savage blows upon the foe.
It's not quite as bad as it sounds… In fact, it's far, far worse. Prepare to die.
Frost-Wyrms dwell in lairs below the frozen tundra, still as death until ascending for murderous activities.
The noble-born warriors of the Empire fight in Knightly Orders, heroic brotherhoods who ride into battle atop mighty barded warhorses.
Understand, mortals, each of your petty champion's ploys are just pieces in my Master's Great Game!
Orc Boyz lack the strength of Big 'Uns, but their tenacity and endurance in battle is well respected.
These Slann mystics bring ruin to the foe's armies and devastation to its cities.
From the home of the first great companion, Thierulf the Lionhearted, come the most ferocious of Bretonnia’s Knights.
They can burrow for leagues when summoned, bursting into battle with a blast of sand and snapping limbs.
Their howls turn even the bravest sailors stark white, spearing their souls like a lance through the heart.
Sheer weight of numbers forced us back, against our best efforts to remain stalwart. That will not happen again. I vow it.
The dread Wheelz crush those caught 'neath their spikey-tracked engines of death!
Every Squire dreams of becoming a Knight, and every Knight dreams of having a better Squire…
The closest cousin of the Scion of the Cold-Void has equally murderous instincts.
Slaanesh has an insatiable appetite for Elven souls, and the Harvesters are only too happy to oblige!
The forest’s champion will not shy away from coming to the Great Oak’s aid, viciously confronting any who dare attack it.
They thrive in melee, with the unbreakable spirit that comes from accepting death.
Above their peers, Zintler's men charge down enemy lines with a destructive fury that makes the earth shake.
Large and heavily-set, Ushoran's descendants are the animalistic blunt instruments of the Vampire race.
The heart of any battle and the embodiment of Sigmar's will as they heroically engage the foe.
Enacting the will of their Slann overlords, magical fury is unleashed upon the Old Ones' foes.
Enacting the will of their Slann overlords, magical fury is unleashed upon the Old Ones' foes.
Enacting the will of their Slann overlords, magical fury is unleashed upon the Old Ones' foes.
Enacting the will of their Slann overlords, magical fury is unleashed upon the Old Ones' foes.
Puissant Bastiladons marked for greatness by the Old Ones.
Malice personified, a Haunter never knows relief from its manic, all-consuming hunger.
Celestial Wizards draw strength from the Comet of Power, calling devastating heavenly magic to rend enemies asunder.
Devilish chariots imbued with dark and eldritch power, driving the Undead to greater, more macabre acts.
The hot, searing Red Wind blows down from the north to inflame passions and, if not used carefully, the spellcasters themselves.
Death whispers to the Bray-Shaman, who speaks the words to his enemies with hideous, incorporeal power.
Is there any greater dealer of death than a Sorceress at the height of her powers? Perhaps… but none will take as great a joy in unleashing it.
The towns of men are but larders of flesh for the followers of the ways of Ragush, ravager of Kalkengard.
Fallen Imperial knights, risen again to serve their ancient Bloodline for eternity.
Once defined by their ability to face trials and overcome hardships, now their only quest is to attend to the vengeful Madame-Captain.
Untamed Cold Ones are far too unpredictable to be ridden into battle; simply point them at the foe and stay out of their way!
A Supreme Sorceress excels at not just Dark Magic, but also the ability to control and summon beasts - a mistress of Ghur.
Having survived the Skaven onslaught that destroyed their home, now they follow the Serpent-God, to the very End Times if necessary.
The White Dwarf is a legendary figure - the mightiest living Dawi warrior.
Rejoice! For a Knight of Bretonnia provides your shield…
Skin Wolves take to the battlefield to glut themselves on the raw and dripping gore of their victims.
These Clanrats' sport nasty, improvised tailblades that are all the more vicious for their homemade ingenuity.
Proponents of the Lore of Life protect and heal friendly troops and allies, whilst forestalling their foes at every turn.
A most evil Sorcerer, known for tormenting his foes by ensuring that death only comes to them after great suffering.
Wading into battle, crazed and unable to be broken, facing their doom with furious acceptance.
For the Empire! For Sigmar! For GLORY!
Although fury and numbers count for much in a fight, a good shield cannot be overstated.
Though deformed and reduced by time, they remain savage warriors and masters of the dead.
Above pride, vanity and selfish ego there is only Athel Loren.
Firm allies for millennia, these majestic birds aid the Elves by swooping onto enemy lines and clawing them apart.
The Wind is stored and harnessed, resulting in the bursting forth of a lethal energy.
These former marksmen and artillerymen are as obsessed with gunpowder in death as they were in life.
A legendary destroyer of both the physical and metaphysical, annihilating souls by trampling foes into an unrecognisable pulp.
This twisted and enraged beast is a terrifying totem of might and power.
They may be literally falling apart at the seams, but this rag-tag band share a dead-eyed accuracy that's hard to beat.
A semi-spectral force that severs mortal souls from their corporeal hosts.
The handmaidens of the Ancients protect their former kingdom from harm, all the while plotting against its usurpers…
More rudimentary than other Dwarf artillery, but nevertheless ruthlessly proficient at destroying their foes.
Forged Runes give the Runesmiths power to enhance allied weapons and armour, and nullify enemy magic to harmless lights.
Distorting the laws of nature, unnatural energies of Chaos imbue this Hellcannon with astonishingly quick firing rates and deadlier projectiles.
Swollen with volatile, noxious gases, their liquefying tissues strain dangerously under rotten and tattered skin.
It is best not to speak ill of the Grey, for they are everywhere and nowhere all at once.
A burning desire for vengeance and justice drives Belegar Ironhammer - he will reclaim his throne, no matter the cost.
Chastised in life due to their recklessness, these Knights exist past their deaths in an eternal state of ghostly damnation.
Armed with spears and carrying bronze shields, these veteran warriors are the best warriors the Al Saurim have to offer.
Armed with spears and carrying bronze shields, these veteran warriors are the best warriors the Al Saurim have to offer.
Armed with spears and carrying bronze shields, these veteran warriors are the best warriors the Al Saurim have to offer.
Puppets of Vangheist’s cadaverous warship, driven by Dark Magic to inflict horror and damage in debilitating abundance.
The Hunter’s javelin takes down the largest of wild beasts, and the most gargantuan of foes.
In amongst the fighting, a Vampire is a danger to her enemies, a vicious warrior and uncompromisingly cruel.
Trained by handmaidens of the Lady, these spellcasters bring nature's power to bear against the foes of Bretonnia.
Queek is unscrupulous, vicious and without mercy. The Skaven, therefore, consider him most admirable.
The half-feral, gore-obsessed Skin Wolves, armoured so their slaughter may continue unabated.
All are made or unmade in the crucible of Dragonfire Pass. So it is with these resolute, peerless Dwarf Warriors.
Poison, horns, claws and teeth; a myriad ways to destroy the foe.
His is the grim, unending task of uprooting and shattering evil in all its forms.
The dead answer my call. When you are dead, you will answer too!
Hoeth-forged steel cries out as its wielders lunge into battle, cutting down foe after foe with their greatswords.
The fury of the gods made stone, these chosen Sphinxes augment their brutal scythe-attack with magic and fire.
Elite amongst their skeletal peers, these spear-armed warriors are as bloodthirsty as their infamous royal patron.
Berserkers fight with the strength of madmen and an absolute disregard for their own lives.
The Raven Heralds appear from nowhere, leaving piles of corpses in their wake.
Mighty in melee, Banshee also debilitate their enemies with fear-inducing screams and wails. Even the hardiest fall before this terror.
Fired from a catapult with crude wings strapped to his arms, the cackling Goblin pilot guides himself to a messy, pointy-hatted impact.
Lying in wait, biding their time. The desert sees all. Nothing escapes.
Armoured carapaces brindled with bloody gristle cover these truly voracious killers of frightening appearance.
Merciless and psychotic, these frenzied Berserkers kill with total devotion to the God of Warriors.
The very image of madness and ruin; the ultimate rat-made menace unleashed.
With a pining cry to the great, weird moon, Morrslieb, these wolves carry their Goblin riders to war.
Well-armoured and resplendent, the Knights deliver a fierce and destructive charge.
Surprise is the greatest of weapons, enabling the stealthy to strike first and hardest, and tip the odds in their favour.
Imagine the foe’s surprise when, in addition to the unexpected attack, their opponents loose two deadly, enchanted arrows at a time!
The control of beasts is usually the domain of Clar Karond, but there are Sorceresses who can wield the Wind of Ghur as well as any lash.
Khalida marches to war with all the poise she had in life, yet more brutal and merciless than ever.
Lethal Saurus marked for greatness by the Old Ones.
Whether casting supportive spells or waves of destruction, victory is carried by the song of spells.
A shower of arrows let loose from behind a constricting wall of smoke awaits any trespassing enemies of the forest.
A Lord of Change is imbued with the power of Tzeentch, able to sow madness and ruination amongst his foes.
These arachnid aberrations make for powerful, terrifying mounts, bringing eight-legged death to their cowering foes.
Spoken of for many ages, this Lord of Change is favoured by Tzeentch himself, and fulfils his dark, malicious purpose.
Otherworldly riders, swift and formidable, fighting viciously in the name of the Lord of all forests and beasts.
Those who enter Athel Loren without permission must answer for such a transgression.
This Chaos Sorcerer is a master of fire, summoning a great conflagration to consume all before him.
Unfeasably large, even for an Ancient Stegadon, fear and dread accompanies this enormous specimen's ground-shaking stomp.
When a poisoned globe explodes, anyone caught in its radius is guaranteed to die a painful, pus-ridden death.
There will be no rest, no peace, until every page of the Dammaz Kron is accounted for!
The Shadow King’s right-hand Elf is as committed to the Druchii’s destruction as his murderous monarch.
Each rider fights with aggressive skill, but they pale in comparison to the viciousness of their mounts!
Their great weapons are wielded as expertly as they did in life, slaying for Lord and glory!
On the field of battle, Black Coaches channel magical energy, making them both stronger in defence and on the charge.
These ghouls remember one thing - war - and they pursue that goal with single-minded savagery.
The Shadow King’s right-hand Elf is just as committed to the Druchii’s destruction as his murderous monarch.
The cornerstone of the Skaven military, less numerous but better trained than the slave class.
Let poisoned arrows fly, and by blessed grace find their mark, though the bowmen may never know why.
The bond between the Elves and the Hawks is unbreakable.
Like the flesh-eating, skull-faced beetle, whose name they bear, this dual-wielding, elite Tomb Guard bring a new level of terror to the battlefield.
Fierce beasts marked for greatness by the Old Ones.
With power syphoned from the ocean’s Winds, the Dreadfleet commander seeks to drown the mortal world in a tide of death.
You'll never find a less trustworthy rabble, but for the right price they'll fight to the death... and beyond.
A stampede of crab-like monsters is all the scarier when accompanied by the hisses and cracks of gunpowder weapons.
Developed by Clan Skryre, these poisoned-wind globes contain an even more virulent strain of deadly gas.
Calling upon violent storms, these monsters manifest their anger in terrifying lightning displays that frequently end in mass death.
In battle is the only time a Dragon Ogre can die, so they fight with a powerful fury.
The Carrion of the Desert, whose mighty outstretched wings darken the sun on the day of slaughter.
The most favoured Asrai of the Trickster God are dazzling, deceptive, and deadly in equal measure.
Boris Todbringer is a man of singular action and determined purpose: to rid the forest of Khazrak's bestial scourge.
High Elf aristocrats are precise and calculating, and they bring this nature to the battlefield.
High Elf aristocrats are precise and calculating, and they bring this nature to the battlefield.
High Elf aristocrats are precise and calculating, and they bring this nature to the battlefield.
High Elf aristocrats are precise and calculating, and they bring this nature to the battlefield.
Acolytes of the green Wind of Magic use the natural world and its seasons to heal and protect their companions.
No longer Vampires, but fighting with the same insane savagery.
Even the very pinnacles of Bretonnian chivalry and brilliance are not immune to being conjured up as ethereal slaves.
Descended from Neferata, thought to be the very first Vampire, Lahmians are alluring, seductive, and deadly in equal measure.
A Giant is possessed of immense strength, and is devastatingly powerful when unleashed upon the opposition's battle line.
Although not as mighty as Orcs, Night Goblins nevertheless control their forces through fear and savage, macabre bloodlust.
Though mocked by stronger beasts, Ungors nevertheless instil fear as they charge the foe down.
The Harbinger of Disease guides their actions, blighting enemies with pus, pestilence, and scourge.
The Harbinger of Disease guides their actions, blighting enemies with pus, pestilence, and scourge.
Put a spear in a man's hand and tell him to brace and he will. He will also hope, and pray.
The High Elves' chief artillery piece can mow down infantry and pierce Giants' hearts.
These men did not ask for war, yet it has come all the same. With sword in hand, they fight because they must.
Savage horned beasts marked for greatness by the Old Ones.
This deadly weapon fires in the blink of an eye, leaving gaping holes and scorched earth in its wake.
Amongst its enemies, a Varghulf is a savage whirl of limbs and claws, devastating in melee.
Ariel's handmaidens know only the defence of their Queen and the forest - an eternal duty, never forsworn.
The flame of the Lady goes with this arrow, and so too the low-born archer before long…
The weight of their ancestry is carried with them, skewering all-comers on their bloody lances.
After riding their enemies down, what grim prize these Goblins claim is their own dark, devilish business.
The Lizardmen elite, charged to defend their sacred grounds, skewering interlopers at the end of their halberds.
The Squires of the ‘Beastslayer’ Duke are amongst the hardiest of Bretonnian infantry, taking his epithet as their name for good reason.
Where marksmanship might be lacking, a more powerful firearm will usually suffice.
Mutations of the frozen north enable them to freeze their unfortunate victims with their foul, icy breath.
The hot, searing Red Wind blows down from the north to inflame passions and, if not used carefully, the spellcasters themselves.
The Dark Convent summon the Ruinous Powers to sow insanity amongst the foe.
These Slayers seek the ultimate blood sport, the greatest beasts, in their unending death-drive.
Though most Undead are no more than stumbling thralls, these warriors have achieved renown due to their effectiveness in melee.
The Pirate King’s personal band of zombie gunmen are a toxic mixture of black powder and noxious imbuements.
Darkness marches before the Bray-Shaman, deceiving and destroying all in its path.
The Siren of the Storm’s tortured soul vengefully roams the world’s seas, singing her paralysing songs of death.
The physical embodiment of the everlasting gods; curse ye all men who look upon their divine forms!
Chieftains lead their Northmen marauders in Chaos' name, hurling themselves into the fray, where they remain until the very end.
There are no Beastmen more loyal to the self-alleged father of all Centigors than these.
Good luck getting close enough to these foul, pestilential creatures to kill them without getting infected!
With hearts to match that of Charandis himself, the Puremane Company are fearless.
The holder of secrets and keeper of the way, whose strength is the quester's ultimate test.
Bigger than normal Orcs, and stronger too, the Orc Boar Big 'Uns ride their beasts into enemy lines, devastating all who face them.
When these Chariots ride to war, there is little that can stand in the way of their terrific charge.
Never missing the mark, one alone is a deadly, formidable opponent.
